Words to Kick Your Teeth Out

The Slow Rot

    1. The slow rot
    2. lived or died, it's hard to tell
    3. And fires lost away ⁠— down to hell
    4. And as wind trow to take ⁠— hero's hearth
    5. To slimy lair ⁠— past danger's berth
    1. The shepherd, lay, in drunken stupor
    2. As wind waste fire back away
    3. So the nimble thief he plot to fire hold
    4. To rob chilly's empty hall of filth and cold
    1. Through rot and ruin barely seeing
    2. In darkness scarce light flickers fleeing
    3. So journeyed Bound in circles round
    4. The hunter searched, following found
    1. Winged death, stumbling, the cripple come!
    2. The slow rot, silent, cold and numb
    3. All gravid full of piss and shit
    4. He bit, swallowed, spit
    1. But thief rallied, brandished knife and struck
    2. Yet the wound was
    3. Not hot and bleeding ⁠— but rotting, eating
    4. The orc only coughed and shook
    5. And yet more the cunning man he ate and took
    1. Hands deep pocketed inside his guts
    2. The thief struck with cuts and cuts
    3. And heart in hand took torch to scour
    4. So doctor kills doctor kills doctor's power!
